content: Parker’s Screening Room idea is laughably bad. Sure, that model makes money when some upper-crust couple decides they’d rather stay in for Woody Allen’s latest instead of traversing all the way to the cinemas. But at that low a price point — which dropped heavily since its debut and is NOT helping their case — the average family of 4 now gets to save at least $10 bucks for the new Avengers. And that’s before Grandma and the cousins come by, AND the pirates get a juicy new stream to hack, AND I start projecting it on my garage for the neighborhood kids at $2 a pop. Someone tell these morons that while they may be “disruptive,” they’d simply be the final nail in big-budget blockbusters which are already killing themselves just fine.
